text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to identify at least one con of the WTO path. The response strongly advises against a single customs entry (which would be the path requiring complex WTO/UK-EU origin substantiation under mixed-consignment rules) and details several severe negative consequences (cons) of attempting this unified approach. Specifically, it lists: 'Customs rejection,' 'VAT penalties (up to 100% of the VAT due),' 'possible anti-dumping duties,' and the high probability of a 'post-clearance audit' with associated legal fees and duties. These clearly satisfy the requirement to list cons of the complex/risky path.", "criterion_id": "b976584c-b8f2-4985-992d-3bb9247d1e3b"}
